Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
  GameManager

public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Object

This is the class that takes care of all the processes that go on in the game. Holds all objects in the game, music being played, player attributes, etc. Manages key presses, music played, power-ups held, and drawing.

Author:
John Kim, Tanner Lai, Raymond Zhao

Field Summary
 boolean inQuestionRoom

Constructor Summary
GameManager(java.awt.Dimension dim)
          This constructor loads the first level and does minimal pre-game set up.
 
Method Summary
 boolean achievedCoin()
          This method is called to check whether or not the hero has obtained enough money to unlock the coin power up.

update

public void update(int frameRate)
This method is called every "frame" and changes all the objects in the game accordingly. It essentially controls all the games interactions and actions.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
This method goes through all the in game objects and draws them onto the screen.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int key)
This method is called when the user pushes a key down. It sends the key's information to be stored in one of this object's sub classes.

Parameters:
key - The integer id of the key pressed down.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(int key)
This method is called when the user releases a key. It sends the key's information to be stored in one of this object's sub classes.

Parameters:
key - The integer id of the key released.
